titleStmt.title: The young mans counsellour, or, The most deserved praise of those sweet complexioned damosels of the black and brown. The pleasant blacks and modest browns, their loving husbands please; now if I had ten thoudand pounds, I'd marry one of these. Tune of All trades. Licensed according to order.

The young mans counsellour, or, The most deserved praise of those sweet complexioned damosels of the black and brown. The pleasant blacks and modest browns, their loving husbands please; now if I had ten thoudand pounds, I'd marry one of these. Tune of All trades. Licensed according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon at the Angel in Gilt-spur-street.,

notesStmt.note: Date and place of publication suggested by Wing.
